{{refimprove|date=September 2011}} {{Football club infobox |
clubname = Portsmouth L.F.C. | image = [[Image:Portsmouth FC crest 2008.png|200px|Portsmouth Football Club Crest]]| fullname = Portsmouth Ladies Football Club | nickname = Pompey Ladies| founded = | ground = Moneyfields F.C., [[Portsmouth]], [[England]] | capacity = 450 sitting | chairman = [[Vladimir Aleksandrovich Antonov|Vladimir Antonov]]| manager = {{flagicon|England}} Vanessa Raynbird |league = [[FA Women's Premier League Southern Division]] | season = 2009â10 | position = [[FA Women's Premier League Southern Division]], 4th | pattern_la1=_blueupper|pattern_b1=_whitesideshape|pattern_ra1=_blueupper| leftarm1=FFFFFF|body1=0000FF|rightarm1=FFFFFF|shorts1=FFFFFF|socks1=FF0000| pattern_la2=_bluelower|pattern_b2=_bluesideshape|pattern_ra2=_bluelower| leftarm2=FFFFFF|body2=0000FF|rightarm2=FFFFFF|shorts2=0000FF|socks2=0000FF| }} '''Portsmouth FC Ladies''', colloquially known as "Pompey Ladies", is a women's [[football club]] for the south coast city of [[Portsmouth]] in [[Hampshire]], [[England]]. The club currently plays in the [[FA Women's Premier League Southern Division]]. Their male counterparts are [[Portsmouth F.C.]]
The club has programmes allowing girls and women of all ages to participate in [[Football (soccer)|football]], and in [[2005]] they became only the second women's club in [[Great Britain| Britain]] to establish a Football Academy for females.[http://www.bbc.co.uk/hampshire/content/articles/2005/08/17/womens_football_feature.shtml]
Their biggest rivals are [[Southampton Saints L.F.C.|Southampton Saints LFC]] and [[Brighton & Hove Albion WFC]]. Unlike their rivals, they have not yet played in the top flight, the [[FA Women's Premier League National Division|Women's Premiership]].
==External links== * [http://www.bbc.co.uk/hampshire/content/articles/2005/08/17/womens_football_feature.shtml BBC Hampshire article on Portsmouth FC Ladies] * [http://www.portsmouthfc.co.uk/squad/ladies.aspx Official website of Portsmouth FC and Portsmouth FC Ladies]
